custom_item_186.description: 4.017 - DOD information system access does not require the use of a password.
custom_item_186.info: The lack of password protection enables anyone to gain access to the information system, which opens a backdoor opportunity for intruders to compromise the system as well as other resources within the same administrative domain.
custom_item_186.solution:
Configure all DoD information systems to require passwords to gain access.

The password required flag can be set by entering the following on a command line- 'Net user/passwordreq-yes'.

custom_item_187.description: 3.119 - The system is configured to allow the display of the last user name on the logon screen.
custom_item_187.info: The user name of the last user to log onto a system will not be displayed.  This eliminates half of the Userid/Password equation that an unauthorized person would need to log on.
custom_item_187.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Interactive logon- Do not display last user name' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_188.description: 3.123 - Auditing Access of Global System Objects must be turned off.
custom_item_188.info: This setting prevents the system from setting up a default system access control list for certain system objects, which could create a very large number of security events, filling the security log in Windows and making it difficult to identify actual issues.
custom_item_188.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Audit- Audit the access of global system objects' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_189.description: 3.124 - Audit of Backup and Restore Privileges is not turned off.
custom_item_189.info: This policy setting stops the system from generating audit events for every file backed up or restored which could fill the Security log in Windows.
custom_item_189.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Audit- Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_190.description: 3.125 - Audit policy using subcategories is enabled.
custom_item_190.info: This policy setting allows administrators to enable the more precise auditing capabilities present in Windows Vista and later.
custom_item_190.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Audit- Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_191.description: 3.126 - Hide Computer from the browse list.
custom_item_191.info: This check verifies Windows Vista is configured to hide the computer from the browse list.
custom_item_191.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'MSS- (Hidden) Hide Computer From the Browse List' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_192.info: This check verifies that Windows is configured to limit IPSec exemptions.
custom_item_192.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'MSS- (NoDefaultExempt) Configure IPSec exemptions for various types of network traffic' to 'Multicast, broadcast and ISAKMP exempt (best for Windows XP)'.

custom_item_193.description: 3.129 - User Account Control - Built In Admin Approval Mode - UAC enabled

custom_item_194.description: 3.129 - User Account Control - Built In Admin Approval Mode
custom_item_194.info: This check verifies whether the built-in Administrator account runs in Admin Approval Mode.
custom_item_194.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_195.description: 3.130 - User Account Control - Behavior of elevation prompt for administrators
custom_item_195.info: This check verifies whether logged on administrator is prompted for consent when he attempts to complete a task that requires raised privileges.
custom_item_195.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' to 'Prompt for consent'.

custom_item_196.description: 3.131 - User Account Control - Behavior of elevation prompt for standard users.
custom_item_196.info: This check verifies whether the logged on user is prompted for credentials when attempting to complete a task that requires raised privileges.
custom_item_196.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users'  to 'Prompt for credentials'.

custom_item_197.description: 3.132 - User Account Control - Detect Application Installations
custom_item_197.info: This check verifies whether Windows responds to application installation requests by prompting for credentials.
custom_item_197.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Detect application installations and prompt for elevation' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_198.description: 3.134 - User Account Control - Elevate UIAccess applications that are in secure locations
custom_item_198.info: This check verifies whether Windows only allows applications installed in a secure location, such as the Program Files or the Windows\System32 folders, on the file system to run with elevated privileges.
custom_item_198.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_199.description: 3.137 - User Account Control - Run all admins in Admin Approval Mode
custom_item_199.info: This check verifies that UAC has not been disabled.
custom_item_199.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_200.description: 3.135 - User Account Control - Switch to secure desktop
custom_item_200.info: This check verifies that the elevation prompt is only used in secure desktop mode.
custom_item_200.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Switch to the secure desktop when prompting for elevation' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_201.description: 3.136 - User Account Control - Non UAC Compliant Application Virtualization
custom_item_201.info: This check verifies that non UAC compliant applications will run in virtualized file and registry entries allowing them to run.
custom_item_201.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control- Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_202.description: 5.132 - Require username and password to elevate a running application.
custom_item_202.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to always require users to type in a user name and password to elevate a running application.
custom_item_202.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Credential User Interface 'Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_203.description: 5.116 - Terminal Services / Remote Desktop Service - Prevent password saving in the Remote Desktop Client
custom_item_203.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent Users from saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client.
custom_item_203.solution: Vista - Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Terminal Services-> Remote Desktop Connection Client 'Do not allow passwords to be saved' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_204.description: 5.117 - Users must be prevented from connecting using Terminal Services.
custom_item_204.info: Allowing a Terminal Services session to a workstation enables another avenue of access that could be exploited.  The system must be configured to prevent users from connecting to a computer using Terminal Services.
custom_item_204.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Terminal Services -> Terminal Server -> Connections 'Allow users to connect remotely using Terminal Services' to 'Disabled.

custom_item_205.description: 5.118 - Terminal Services / Remote Desktop Services - Local drives prevented from sharing with Terminal Servers.
custom_item_205.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent users from sharing the local drives on their client computers to Terminal Servers that they access.
custom_item_205.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Terminal Services -> Terminal Server -> Device and Resource Redirection 'Do not allow drive redirection' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_206.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to restrict unauthenticated RPC clients from connecting to the RPC server.
custom_item_206.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Remote Procedure Call 'Restrictions for Unauthenticated RPC clients' to 'Enabled' and 'Authenticated'.

custom_item_207.description: 5.124 - Client computers required to authenticate for RPC communication.
custom_item_207.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to force client computers to provide authentication before an RPC communication is established.
custom_item_207.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Remote Procedure Call 'RPC Endpoint Mapper Client Authentication' to 'Enabled.

custom_item_208.description: 5.125 - File and Folder Publish to Web option unavailable.
custom_item_208.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to make the options to publish to the web unavailable from File and Folder Tasks in Windows folders.
custom_item_208.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication setting 'Turn off the 'Publish to Web' task for files and folders' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_209.description: 5.126 - Web Publishing and online ordering wizards prevented from downloading list of providers.
custom_item_209.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent Windows from downloading a list of providers for the Web publishing and online ordering wizards.
custom_item_209.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication setting 'Turn off Internet download for Web publishing and online ordering wizards' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_210.description: 5.127 - Windows Messenger prevented from collecting anonymous information.
custom_item_210.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent Windows Messenger from collecting anonymous information about how the Windows Messenger software and service is used.
custom_item_210.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication setting 'Turn off the Windows Messenger Customer Experience Improvement Program' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_211.description: 5.128 - Search Companion prevented from automatically downloading content updates.
custom_item_211.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent Search Companion from automatically downloading content updates during local and Internet searches.
custom_item_211.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication setting 'Turn off Search Companion content file updates' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_212.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent the client computer's ability to print over HTTP, which allows the computer to print to printers on the intranet as well as the Internet.
custom_item_212.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication setting 'Turn off printing over HTTP' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_213.description: 5.130 - Computer prevented from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.
custom_item_213.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent the computer from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.
custom_item_213.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication setting 'Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_214.description: 5.131 - Windows is prevented from using Windows Update to search for drivers.
custom_item_214.info: This check verifies that the system is configured to prevent Windows from searching Windows Update for device drivers when no local drivers for a device are present.
custom_item_214.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication setting 'Turn off Windows Update device driver searching' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_215.description: 5.050 - IPv6 must be disabled until a deliberate transition strategy has been implemented.
custom_item_215.info: Any nodes' interface with IPv6 enabled by default presents a potential risk of traffic being transmitted or received without proper risk mitigation strategy and is therefore, a serious security concern.

custom_item_216.description: 5.134 - Preserve Zone information when saving attachments.
custom_item_216.info: This check verifies that file attachments are marked with their zone of origin allowing Windows to determine risk.
custom_item_216.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Attachment Manager -> 'Do not preserve zone information in file attachments' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_217.description: 5.135 - Hide mechanism for removing Zone information from file attachments.
custom_item_217.info: This check verifies that users cannot manually remove zone information from saved file attachments.
custom_item_217.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Attachment Manager -> 'Hide mechanisms to remove zone information' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_218.description: 5.136 - Notify antivirus when file attachments are opened.
custom_item_218.info: This check verifies that antivirus programs are notified when a user opens a file attachment.
custom_item_218.solution: Configure policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Attachment Manager -> 'Notify antivirus programs when opening attachments' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_219.description: 5.140 - The HBSS McAfee Agent is not installed. - FrameworkService
custom_item_219.solution: Deploy the McAfee Agent as detailed in accordance with the DoD HBSS STIG.

custom_item_220.description: 5.140 - The HBSS McAfee Agent is not installed. - masvc
custom_item_220.solution: Deploy the McAfee Agent as detailed in accordance with the DoD HBSS STIG.

custom_item_221.info: This check verifies Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Service is turned off.
custom_item_221.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Services 'Turn Off Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Services' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_222.info: This check verifies the Network Bridge can not be installed and configured.
custom_item_222.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Network Connections 'Prohibit installation and configuration of Network Bridge on your DNS domain network' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_223.info: This check verifies that Events.asp hyperlinks in Event Viewer are available.
custom_item_223.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off Event Viewer 'Events.asp' links' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_224.info: This check verifies that the Internet Connection Wizard cannot download a list of Internet Service Providers (ISPs) from Microsoft.
custom_item_224.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off Internet Connection Wizard if URL connection is referring to Microsoft.com' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_225.info: This check verifies that unhandled file associations will not use the Microsoft Web service to find an application.
custom_item_225.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off Internet File Association service' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_226.info: This check verifies that the Windows Registration Wizard is blocked from online registration.
custom_item_226.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off Registration if URL connection is referring to Microsoft.com' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_227.info: This check verifies that the 'Order Prints Online' task is not available in Windows Explorer.
custom_item_227.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off the 'Order Prints' picture task' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_228.info: This check verifies that the codecs will not be automatically downloaded for Windows Movie Maker.
custom_item_228.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off Windows Movie Maker automatic codec downloads' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_229.info: This check verifies that the links to web sites in Windows Movie Maker will not be available.
custom_item_229.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off Windows Movie Maker online Web links' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_230.info: This check verifies that movies can not be sent to a video hosting provider on the web.
custom_item_230.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings 'Turn off Windows Movie Maker saving to online video hosting provider' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_231.description: 5.231 - Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
custom_item_231.info: Attachments from RSS feeds may not be secure.  This setting will prevent attachments from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
custom_item_231.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> RSS Feeds -> 'Turn off downloading of enclosures' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_232.description: 5.240 - Windows Explorer - Shell Protocol Protected Mode
custom_item_232.info: This check verifies that the shell protocol is run in protected mode.  (This allows applications to only open limited folders.)
custom_item_232.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Explorer 'Turn off shell protocol protected mode' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_233.info: This check verifies that users are notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.
custom_item_233.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer 'Disable IE security prompt for Windows Installer scripts' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_234.info: This check verifies that users are prevented from changing installation options.
custom_item_234.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer 'Enable user control over installs' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_235.info: This check verifies that users are prevented applying vendor signed updates.
custom_item_235.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer 'Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_236.description: 5.248 - Media Player - First Use Dialog Boxes
custom_item_236.info: This check verifies that users are not presented with Privacy and Installation options on first use of Windows Media Player.
custom_item_236.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Media Player 'Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_238.info: This check verifies that the Mapper I/O network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_238.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Mapper I/O (LLTDIO) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_239.info: This check verifies that the Mapper I/O network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_239.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Mapper I/O (LLTDIO) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_240.info: This check verifies that the Mapper I/O network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_240.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Mapper I/O (LLTDIO) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_241.info: This check verifies that the Mapper I/O network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_241.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Mapper I/O (LLTDIO) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_242.info: This check verifies that the Responder network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_242.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Responder (RSPNDR) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_243.info: This check verifies that the Responder network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_243.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Responder (RSPNDR) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_244.info: This check verifies that the Responder network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_244.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Responder (RSPNDR) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_245.info: This check verifies that the Responder network protocol driver is disabled.
custom_item_245.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Link-Layer Topology Discovery 'Turn on Responder (RSPNDR) driver' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_247.description: 5.206 - Network - Windows Connect Now Wireless Configuration - DisableFlashConfigRegistrar
custom_item_247.info: This check verifies that the configuration of wireless devices using Windows Connect Now is disabled.
custom_item_247.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Windows Connect Now 'Configuration of wireless settings using Windows Connect Now' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_248.description: 5.206 - Network - Windows Connect Now Wireless Configuration - DisableInBand802DOT11Registrar
custom_item_248.info: This check verifies that the configuration of wireless devices using Windows Connect Now is disabled.
custom_item_248.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Windows Connect Now 'Configuration of wireless settings using Windows Connect Now' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_249.description: 5.206 - Network - Windows Connect Now Wireless Configuration - DisableUPnPRegistrar
custom_item_249.info: This check verifies that the configuration of wireless devices using Windows Connect Now is disabled.
custom_item_249.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Windows Connect Now 'Configuration of wireless settings using Windows Connect Now' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_250.description: 5.206 - Network - Windows Connect Now Wireless Configuration - DisableWPDRegistrar
custom_item_250.info: This check verifies that the configuration of wireless devices using Windows Connect Now is disabled.
custom_item_250.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Windows Connect Now 'Configuration of wireless settings using Windows Connect Now' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_251.description: 5.206 - Network - Windows Connect Now Wireless Configuration - EnableRegistrars
custom_item_251.info: This check verifies that the configuration of wireless devices using Windows Connect Now is disabled.
custom_item_251.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Windows Connect Now 'Configuration of wireless settings using Windows Connect Now' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_252.info: This check verifies that access to the Windows Connect Now wizards is disabled.
custom_item_252.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Windows Connect Now 'Prohibit Access of the Windows Connect Now wizards' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_253.description: 5.208 - Device Install - PnP Interface Remote Access
custom_item_253.info: This check verifies that remote access to the Plug and Play interface is disabled.
custom_item_253.solution: Vista -  Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation 'Allow remote access to the PnP interface' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_254.description: 5.209 - Device Install - Drivers System Restore Point
custom_item_254.info: This check verifies that a system restore point will be created when a new device driver is installed.
custom_item_254.solution: Vista - Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation 'Do not create a system restore point when new device driver installed' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_255.description: 5.210 - Device Install - Generic Driver Error Report
custom_item_255.info: This check verifies that an Error Report will not be sent when a generic device driver is installed.
custom_item_255.solution: Vista - Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation 'Do not send a Windows Error Report when a generic driver is installed on a system' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_256.description: 5.211 - Driver Install - Device Driver Search Prompt
custom_item_256.info: This check verifies that users will not be prompted to search Windows Updated for device drivers.
custom_item_256.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Driver Installation 'Turn off Windows Update device driver search prompt' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_257.info: This check verifies that errors in handwriting recognition on Tablet PCs are not reported to Microsoft.
custom_item_257.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communications settings 'Turn off handwriting recognition error reporting' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_258.description: 5.224 - Power Mgmt - Password Wake on Battery
custom_item_258.info: This check verifies that the user is prompted for a password on resume from sleep (on battery).
custom_item_258.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Power Management -> Sleep Settings 'Require a Password When a Computer Wakes (On Battery)' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_259.description: 5.225 - Power Mgmt - Password Wake When Plugged In
custom_item_259.info: This check verifies that the user is prompted for a password on resume from sleep (Plugged In).
custom_item_259.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Power Management -> Sleep Settings 'Require a Password When a Computer Wakes (Plugged In)' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_260.info: This check verifies that Remote Assistance log files will be generated.
custom_item_260.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Remote Assistance 'Turn on session logging' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_261.info: This check verifies that Digital Locker, a dedicated download manager can not run.
custom_item_261.solution: Vista - Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Digital Locker 'Do not allow Digital Locker to run' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_262.info: This check verifies that game information is not downloaded from Windows Metadata Services.
custom_item_262.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Game Explorer 'Turn off downloading of game information' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_263.info: This check verifies that untrusted content is not rendered for online assistance.
custom_item_263.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Online Assistance 'Turn off Untrusted Content' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_264.info: This check verifies that encrypted files are not indexed.
custom_item_264.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Search 'Allow indexing of encrypted files' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_265.description: 5.233 - Indexing of mail items in Exchange folders when Outlook is running in uncached mode must be turned off.
custom_item_265.info: Indexing of encrypted items may expose sensitive data.  This setting prevents mail items in a Microsoft Exchange folder from being indexed when Outlook is running in uncached mode.
custom_item_265.solution:
If Outlook is not installed on the system, this is NA.
If Outlook is installed on the system, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Search -> 'Enable indexing uncached Exchange folders' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_266.info: This check verifies that SpyNet membership is disabled.
custom_item_266.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Defender 'Configure Microsoft Spynet Reporting' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_267.description: WINER-000003 - The system must be configured to save Error Reporting events and messages to the system event log.
custom_item_267.info: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  This setting ensures that Error Reporting events will be saved in the system event log.
custom_item_267.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> 'Disable logging' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_268.description: WINER-000002 - The system must be configured to generate error reports.
custom_item_268.info: Enabling Windows Error Reporting generates information useful to system administrators and forensics analysts for diagnosing system problems and investigating intrusions.  If Windows Error Reporting is turned off, valuable system diagnostic and vulnerability information may be lost.
custom_item_268.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> 'Disable Windows Error Reporting' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_269.description: WINER-000004 - The system must be configured to allow a local or DOD-wide collector to request additional error reporting.
custom_item_269.info: Sending additional error reporting data provides valuable system diagnostic and vulnerability information that would otherwise not be generated nor collected.  This setting controls whether additional data in support of error reports can be sent to a local or DOD-wide reporting site.
custom_item_269.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> 'Do not send additional data' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_270.info: This check verifies that heap termination on corruption is disabled.  This may prevent Windows Explorer from terminating immediately from certain legacy plug-in applications.
custom_item_270.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Explorer 'Turn off heap termination on corruption' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_271.info: This check verifies that Windows Mail will not check newsgroups for Communities support.
custom_item_271.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Mail 'Turn off the communities features' to 'Enabled'

custom_item_272.info: This check verifies that Windows Mail will be disabled.
custom_item_272.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Mail 'Turn off Windows Mail application' to 'Enabled'

custom_item_273.info: This check verifies that Windows Media Digital Rights Management will be prevented from accessing the internet.
custom_item_273.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Media Digital Rights Management 'Prevent Windows Media DRM Internet Access' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_274.info: This check verifies that Windows Meeting Space is disabled.
custom_item_274.solution: Vista - Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Meeting Space 'Turn off Windows Meeting Space' to 'Enabled'

custom_item_275.description: 5.250 - Unsigned gadgets must not be installed.

custom_item_276.description: 5.250 - Unsigned gadgets must not be installed. - TurnOffUnsignedGadgets
custom_item_276.info: Uncontrolled installation of applications can introduce various issues, including system instability, and allow access to sensitive information.  Installation of applications must be controlled by the enterprise.  This setting prevents unsigned gadgets from being installed.
custom_item_276.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Sidebar ->  'Disable unpacking and installation of gadgets that are not digitally signed' to 'Enabled'.

To turn off Windows Sidebar completely, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Sidebar -> 'Turn off Windows Sidebar' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_277.description: 5.251 - The More Gadgets link must be disabled.
custom_item_277.info: Uncontrolled installation of applications can introduce various issues, including system instability, and allow access to sensitive information.  Installation of applications must be controlled by the enterprise.  This setting prevents access to gadgets through the More Gadgets link.
custom_item_277.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Sidebar -> 'Override the More Gadgets Link' to 'Enabled' with 'about-blank' entered in the 'Override Gadget Location'.

To turn off Windows Sidebar completely, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Sidebar -> 'Turn off Windows Sidebar' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_278.description: 5.252 - User-installed gadgets must be turned off.
custom_item_278.info: Uncontrolled installation of applications can introduce various issues, including system instability, and allow access to sensitive information.  Installation of applications must be controlled by the enterprise.  This setting prevents user-installed gadgets from running.
custom_item_278.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Sidebar -> 'Turn Off User Installed Windows Sidebar Gadgets' to 'Enabled'.

To turn off Windows Sidebar completely, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Sidebar -> 'Turn off Windows Sidebar' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_279.info: This check verifies that users are prevented from sharing files.
custom_item_279.solution:
Note-  This setting is under USER Configuration not COMPUTER Configuration

Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Network Sharing 'Prevent users from sharing files within their profile' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_280.info: This check verifies that software certificate installation files have been removed from a system.
custom_item_280.solution:
Remove any certificate installation files found on a system.

Note-  This does not apply to server-based applications that have a requirement for .p12 certificate files (e.g., Oracle Wallet Manager)

custom_item_281.description: 5.254 - Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program is disabled.
custom_item_281.info: This check verifies that the Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program is disabled so information is not passed to the vendor.
custom_item_281.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication Settings -> 'Turn off Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_282.description: 5.255 - Help Experience Improvement Program is disabled.
custom_item_282.info: This check verifies that the Windows Help Experience Improvement Program is disabled to prevent information from being passed to the vendor.
custom_item_282.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication Settings -> 'Turn off Help Experience Improvement Program' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_283.info: This check verifies that Windows Vista is configured to disable the built-in administrator account which provides no accountability.
custom_item_283.solution: Configure the system to disable the built-in administrator account.

custom_item_284.info: This check verifies that the users cannot provide ratings feedback to Microsoft for Help content
custom_item_284.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication Settings -> 'Turn off Help Ratings' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_285.info: This check verifies that Windows is configured to not limit access to CD drives when a user is logged on locally per the FDCC.
custom_item_285.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Devices- Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_286.info: This check verifies that elevation of application in UAC is not restricted to signed and validated applications per the FDCC.
custom_item_286.solution: Configure the setting for 'User Account Control- Only elevate executables that are signed and validated' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_287.info: This registry key will prevent the autorun.inf from executing commands.
custom_item_287.solution: Add the registry value as specified in the manual check.

custom_item_288.description: 4.005 - Unapproved Users have access to Debug programs.
custom_item_288.info: This is a Category 1 finding as it provides access to the kernel with complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components.
custom_item_288.solution: Configure the system to remove any accounts from the 'Debug programs' user right.

custom_item_289.description: 2.023 - Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Winlogon registry key.
custom_item_289.info: Permissions on the Winlogon registry key must only allow privileged accounts to change registry values. If standard users have this capability there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system.

custom_item_290.description: WINPK-000001 - The DoD Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store.
custom_item_290.info:
To ensure secure DoD websites and DoD-signed code are properly validated, the system must trust the DoD Root Certificate Authorities (CAs). The DoD root certificates will ensure that the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the DoD CAs.

      NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_290.solution:
Install the DoD Root CA certificates.
DoD Root CA 2
DoD Root CA 3
DoD Root CA 4

The InstallRoot tool is available on IASE at http-//iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

custom_item_291.description: WINPK-000002 - The External Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store on unclassified systems.
custom_item_291.info:
To ensure secure websites protected with External Certificate Authority (ECA) server certificates are properly validated, the system must trust the ECA Root CAs. The ECA root certificates will ensure the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the External CAs. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.

      NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_291.solution:
Install the ECA Root CA certificates on unclassified systems.
ECA Root CA 2
ECA Root CA 4

The InstallRoot tool is available on IASE at http-//iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

custom_item_292.description: WINPK-000003 - The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed.
custom_item_292.info:
To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.

      NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_292.solution:
Install the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates on unclassified systems.

Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint
DoD Root CA 2 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 1 - 99C494ECE4FC093EEE13C4D65B1B1E01B9B5D434
DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - FFAD03329B9E527A43EEC66A56F9CBB5393E6E13
DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - FCE1B1E25374DD94F5935BEB86CA643D8C8D1FF4

Administrators should run the Federal Bridge Certification Authority (FBCA) Cross-Certificate Removal Tool once as an administrator and once as the current user.

The FBCA Cross-Certificate Remover tool and user guide is available on IASE at http-//iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

custom_item_293.description: WINRG-000001  - Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key.
custom_item_293.info: Permissions on the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key must only allow privileged accounts to add or change registry values.  If standard user accounts have this capability there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system.

custom_item_294.description: WINCC-000001 - The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges must be disabled.
custom_item_294.info: Standard user accounts must not be granted elevated privileges.  Enabling Windows Installer to elevate privileges when installing applications can allow malicious persons and applications to gain full control of a system.
custom_item_294.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer -> 'Always install with elevated privileges' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_295.description: WINRG-000003 - Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges.
custom_item_295.info:
A compromised local administrator account can provide means for an attacker to move laterally between domain systems.

With User Account Control enabled, filtering the privileged token for local administrator accounts will prevent the elevated privileges of these accounts from being used over the network.
custom_item_295.solution:
Configure the following registry value-

Registry Hive-  HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
Subkey- SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System

Value Name-  LocalAccountTokenFilterPolicy

Type-  REG_DWORD
Value-  0

custom_item_296.description: WINFW-000100 -  Inbound exceptions to the firewall on domain workstations must only allow authorized management systems.
custom_item_296.info:
Allowing inbound access to domain workstations from other systems may allow lateral movement across systems if credentials are compromised.  Limiting inbound connections only from authorized management systems and remote management hosts will help limit this exposure.

      NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_296.solution:
Ensure firewall exceptions to inbound connections on domain workstations only allow authorized management systems and remote management hosts.

Firewall rules can be complex and should be thoroughly tested be applying in a production environment.

One method for restricting inbound connections is to only allow exceptions for a specific scope of remote IP addresses.  For any inbound rules that allow connections from other systems, configure the Scope for Remote IP address to those of authorized management systems and remote management hosts. This may be defined as an IP address, subnet or range. Apply the rule to all firewall profiles.

If a third-party firewall is used, configure inbound exceptions to only include authorized remote management hosts.

custom_item_297.description: WINCC-000078 - EMET system-wide Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) must be enabled and configured to Application Opt In.
custom_item_297.info: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications.  The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.
custom_item_297.solution:
This is applicable to unclassified systems, for other systems this is NA.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> EMET -> 'System ASLR' to 'Enabled' with 'Application Opt-In' selected.

The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.

custom_item_298.description: WINCC-000079 - EMET Default Protections for Internet Explorer must be enabled.
custom_item_298.info: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications.  The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.
custom_item_298.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> EMET >> 'Default Protections for Internet Explorer' to 'Enabled'.

Note- The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.

Due to a change in the registry structure for EMET 5.5, if the system has a previous version of EMET installed and configured, this setting needs to be set to 'Not Configured' prior to the upgrade to EMET 5.5, and the new administrative template files copied to the appropriate area.  The setting can then be re-enabled.

Due to a change in the registry structure for EMET 5.5, if the system has a previous version of EMET installed and configured, this setting needs to be set to 'Not Configured' prior to the upgrade to EMET 5.5, and the new administrative template files copied to the appropriate area.  The setting can then be re-enabled.

custom_item_351.description: WINCC-000082 - EMET system-wide Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be enabled and configured to at least Application Opt Out.
custom_item_351.info: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications.  The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.
custom_item_351.solution:
This is applicable to unclassified systems, for other systems this is NA.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> EMET -> 'System DEP' to 'Enabled' with at least 'Application Opt-Out' selected.

The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.

Document applications that do not function properly due to this setting, and are opted out, with the ISSO.

Opted out exceptions can be configured with the following command-
EMET_Conf --Set 'application path\executable name' -DEP

Alternately, configure exceptions in System Properties-
Select 'System' in Control Panel.
Select 'Advanced system settings'.
Click 'Settings' in the 'Performance' section.
Select the 'Data Execution Prevention' tab.
Select 'Turn on DEP for all programs and services except those I select-'.

Applications that are opted out are configured in the window below this selection.

custom_item_352.description: WINCC-000083 - EMET system-wide Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be configured to Application Opt Out.
custom_item_352.info: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. This is applicable to unclassified systems, for other systems this is NA.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> EMET -> 'System SEHOP' to 'Enabled' with 'Application Opt-Out' selected.

The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.

Document applications that do not function properly due to this setting, and are opted out, with the ISSO.

Opted out exceptions can be configured with the following command-
EMET_Conf --Set 'application path\executable name' -SEHOP

custom_item_353.description: WINGE-000100 - EMET v5.5 or later must be installed on the system.
custom_item_353.info: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications.  The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.
custom_item_353.solution: Install EMET v5.5 or later on the system. EMET is available for download from Microsoft.
custom_item_353.powershell_args: Get-WmiObject Win32_Product | where-object {$_.Description -match 'EMET 5'} | SELECT Version | Format-List

custom_item_354.description: WINPK-000004 - The US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate must be installed.
custom_item_354.info:
To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.

      NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_354.solution:
Install the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate on unclassified systems.

Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint
DoD Root CA 2 - US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA 1 - DA36FAF56B2F6FBA1604F5BE46D864C9FA013BA3

Administrators should run the Federal Bridge Certification Authority (FBCA) Cross-Certificate Removal Tool once as an administrator and once as the current user.

The FBCA Cross-Certificate Remover tool and user guide is available on IASE at http-//iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

custom_item_355.description: WINFW-000001 - A host-based firewall must be installed and enabled on the system.
custom_item_355.info: A firewall provides a line of defense against attack, allowing or blocking inbound and outbound connections based on a set of rules.
custom_item_355.solution: Install and enable a host-based firewall on the system.

custom_item_356.description: WINCC-000147 - The touch keyboard or input panel must not highlight keys as passwords are entered. - PasswordSecurityState
custom_item_356.info: The touch keyboard or input panel may highlight keys as passwords are entered, providing visibility to nearby persons, and compromising them.
custom_item_356.solution:
If the system does not have a touch screen, this is NA.
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Tablet PC -> Input Panel -> 'Turn off password security in Input Panel' to at least 'Enabled- Medium High'.

custom_item_357.description: WINCC-000147 - The touch keyboard or input panel must not highlight keys as passwords are entered. - PasswordSecurity
custom_item_357.info: The touch keyboard or input panel may highlight keys as passwords are entered, providing visibility to nearby persons, and compromising them.
custom_item_357.solution:
If the system does not have a touch screen, this is NA.
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Tablet PC -> Input Panel -> 'Turn off password security in Input Panel' to at least 'Enabled- Medium High'.

custom_item_358.description: WINER-000001 - The Windows Error Reporting Service must be running and configured to start automatically.
custom_item_358.info: Windows Error Reporting information can be used to help diagnose day-to-day software issues, as well as help discover malicious code and possibly zero-day attacks on systems.
custom_item_358.solution: Configure the Start Type of the Windows Error Reporting Service to 'Automatic' and ensure the service has a status of 'Started'.

custom_item_359.description: WINER-000006 - The system must be configured to prevent the display of error messages to the user.
custom_item_359.info: Displaying error messages to users provides them the option of sending the reports.  Error reports should be sent silently, unknown to the user.  This setting controls whether users are shown an error dialog box that lets them report an error.
custom_item_359.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> 'Prevent display of the user interface for critical errors' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_360.description: WINER-000007 - The system must be configured to store error reports locally, and not send them to Microsoft.

custom_item_361.description: WINER-000008 - The system must be configured to use SSL to forward error reports.
custom_item_361.info: The use of SSL enables the secure forwarding of error reporting data from local systems to a reporting site.
custom_item_361.solution:
This requirement is NA if Windows Error Reporting is not configured to forward reports to a collection server (see V-57457).

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Corporate Windows Error Reporting' to 'Enabled' with 'Connect using SSL' selected.

custom_item_362.description: WINER-000009 - The system must be configured to send error reports on TCP port 1232.
custom_item_362.info: An error reporting site's TCP port must be defined in the local system in order to forward data from local systems via TCP.  Port 1232 is the recommended port setting.
custom_item_362.solution:
This requirement is NA if Windows Error Reporting is not configured to forward reports to a collection server (see V-57457).

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Corporate Windows Error Reporting' to 'Enabled' with '1232' defined as the 'Server Port'.

custom_item_363.description: WINER-000010 - The system must be configured to archive error reports.
custom_item_363.info: The error reporting archive is stored locally on the system, and is created after an error report has been sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined).  This creates a backup of the error reporting.
custom_item_363.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Report Archive' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_364.description: WINER-000011 - The system must be configured to store all data in the error report archive.
custom_item_364.info: The error reporting archive is stored locally on the system and is created after an error report has been sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined).  Storing all data, including memory contents, adds data that is very helpful in analyzing the errors.
custom_item_364.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Report Archive' to 'Enabled' with 'Store All' selected for 'Archive behavior-'.

custom_item_365.description: WINER-000012 - The maximum number of error reports to archive on a system must be configured to 100 or greater.
custom_item_365.info: The retention of archived reports provides a history.  Older reports are automatically deleted as new reports are generated once the maximum limit has been met.  The archive is stored locally on the system and is created after the error report has been sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined).
custom_item_365.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Report Archive' to 'Enabled' with 'Maximum number of reports to store-' set to '100' or greater.

custom_item_366.description: WINER-000013 - The system must be configured to queue error reports until a local or DOD-wide collector is available.
custom_item_366.info: Queueing error reports provides the ability for a system to collect reports locally or until a collection server can be contacted.  Valuable system diagnostic and vulnerability information may be lost if the report queue is disabled.
custom_item_366.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Report Queue' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_367.description: WINER-000014 - The system must be configured to add all error reports to the queue.
custom_item_367.info: Error reports are queued for sending to an error reporting site when the queueing behavior is set to Always Queue.  This will maintain the reports in the queue until a connection can be made to the collection server.
custom_item_367.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Report Queue' to 'Enabled' with 'Queuing behavior-' to 'Always queue'.

custom_item_368.description: WINER-000015 - The maximum number of error reports to queue on a system must be configured to 50 or greater.
custom_item_368.info: The error reporting queue is stored locally on the system and contains the error reports until they have been manually removed or automatically sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined).  Once a report has been sent to a collector, it is moved to the report archive.  Old reports are deleted as new ones arrive once the maximum limit has been met.
custom_item_368.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Report Queue' to 'Enabled' with 'Maximum number of reports to queue-' set to '50' or greater.

custom_item_369.description: WINER-000016 - The system must be configured to attempt to forward queued error reports once a day.
custom_item_369.info: Error reports stored in the queue should be forwarded to a local or DOD-wide collection site when the system can connect to the site.  This setting controls the frequency a system will use to try forwarding queued reports to the local or DOD-wide collector.
custom_item_369.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Advanced Error Reporting Settings -> 'Configure Report Queue' to 'Enabled' with 'Number of days between solution check reminders-' set to '1'.

custom_item_370.description: WINER-000017 - Automatically consent to send all data requested by a local or DOD-wide error collection site.
custom_item_370.info: Configuring error reporting to send all requested data ensures all relevant data associated with the error report is captured for later analysis.  This setting determines the default consent behavior of Windows Error Reporting.
custom_item_370.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Consent -> 'Configure Default consent' to 'Enabled' with 'Send all data' selected for 'Consent level'.

custom_item_371.description: WINER-000018 - The system must be configured to permit the default consent levels of Windows Error Reporting to override.
custom_item_371.info: This setting determines the behavior of the 'Configure Default Consent' setting in relation to custom consent settings.  Enabling this allows the default consent levels of Windows Error Reporting to always override any other consent policy setting.
custom_item_371.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Error Reporting -> Consent -> 'Ignore custom consent settings' to 'Enabled'.
